thread.title: NHL: Chicago Blackhawks send Columbus Blue Jackets to another loss
thread.title_full: NHL: Chicago Blackhawks send Columbus Blue Jackets to another loss

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Chicago Blackhawks send Columbus Blue Jackets to another loss
text:
NHL: Chicago Blackhawks send Columbus Blue Jackets to another loss Associated Press Posted: 10/17/2015 10:26:15 PM PDT Updated: 10/17/2015 10:26:16 PM PDT saturDAY'S HIGHLIGHTS Blackhawks 4, Blue Jackets 1: Artem Anisimov and Teuvo Teravainen scored 1:05 apart late in the second period to break a scoreless tie, and Chicago beat Columbus, extending the Blue Jackets' worst start in franchise history with their sixth straight loss to begin the season. 
Stars 4, Panthers 2: Tyler Seguin and Jamie Benn scored two goals each to rally Dallas over Florida. Seguin gave Dallas its first lead with 3:02 remaining. 
Bruins 5, Coyotes 3: Patrice Bergeron scored twice in the last 11 minutes to lift Boston past Arizona. 
Oilers 5, Flames 2: Connor McDavid scored twice and added an assist for the first multipoint game of his young career as Edmonton beat Calgary. 
Penguins 2, Maple Leafs 1: Evgeni Malkin and Olli Maatta scored first-period goals and Pittsburgh held on to win. 
Canadiens 4, Red Wings 1: Jeff Petry scored the go-ahead goal 6:32 into the third period and Montreal moved to 6-0-0 for the first time in team history. 
Capitals 4, Hurricanes 1: Nicklas Backstrom had a goal and two assists in his season debut to lead Washington to victory. 
Predators 4, Senators 3: James Neal scored twice in regulation and the shootout winner as Nashville defeated Ottawa. 
Avalanche: Defenseman Tyson Barrie was suspended three games without pay by the NHL for charging and interference on Anaheim's Simon Despres on Friday. Advertisement 
Ducks: Anaheim recalled star prospect Shea Theodore and fellow defenseman Korbinian Holzer from San Diego of the AHL. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
